page.title: 07 Godspeed
page.content: In 1585 a series of remarkable voyages from Britain began to attempt to establish the first colony in North America. For 21 years the country's best efforts were in vain, until in 1606 a small fleet of three ships left Blackwall in the Thames to become the founders of North America. The ships were the Discovery, the Godspeed and the Susan Constant. All arrived safely. The voyage had been proposed by a Suffolk man, Bartholomew Gosnold. He had sailed to the New World four years before. He chose to be master of the middle-sized ship the Godspeed. To judge by her design, this ship was the most seaworthy. Gosnold's family home was Otley Hall.
